{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3411692,"name":"Noam Amar","username":"NoamAmar","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/43a26b/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-07-28T15:27:36.123Z","cooked":"

my team wants to implement advantage kit log server, we already have replay and such, but want to extend logs to a coprocessor such as rasperry pi. how do we set up the rio for this and how do we set up the coprocessor for this?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2024-07-28T15:27:36.123Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":62,"reads":113,"readers_count":112,"score":332.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":469235,"topic_slug":"advantage-kit-rlog","display_username":"Noam Amar","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61206,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/advantage-kit-rlog/469235/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3411705,"name":"Jonah Bonner","username":"jonahb55","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jonahb55/{size}/194474_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-28T16:59:30.613Z","cooked":"

Could you elaborate on what your end goal is? What are you doing on the coprocessor and what functionality are you trying to enable with logging?

Usually, it makes the most sense to just log the coprocessor data as an input to the robot code via an IO layer (like any other sensor input). If you have a more specific use case there may be another structure that makes sense though.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2024-07-28T16:59:30.613Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":99,"readers_count":98,"score":39.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":469235,"topic_slug":"advantage-kit-rlog","display_username":"Jonah Bonner","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44471,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6328M/WPILib"},"post_url":"/t/advantage-kit-rlog/469235/2","custom_user_title":"6328M/WPILib","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3411708,"name":"Noam Amar","username":"NoamAmar","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/43a26b/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-07-28T17:13:05.422Z","cooked":"

We essentially want to use send all of the data we want to log to the coprocessor and save it there, that way the rio doesn’t need to save the logs and to write them potentially saving resources for the rio. I saw the Logger has an option to add an RLOG as a data receiver, is that related, and if yes how would we set up the coprocessor to accept these logs and save them.
Thanks you.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2024-07-28T17:13:05.422Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":82,"readers_count":81,"score":21.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":469235,"topic_slug":"advantage-kit-rlog","display_username":"Noam Amar","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":44471,"username":"jonahb55","name":"Jonah Bonner","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jonahb55/{size}/194474_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61206,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/advantage-kit-rlog/469235/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3411723,"name":"Jonah Bonner","username":"jonahb55","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jonahb55/{size}/194474_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-28T18:54:31.783Z","cooked":"

AdvantageKit natively supports three formats: WPILOG (for log files and replay), NT (for live streaming), and RLOG (for live streaming). RLOG is actually an older format which we’ve kept around for experimental purposes, and can theoretically be saved to a log file (AdvantageScope can open them, but AdvantageKit no longer has the code to read or write those files).

Essentially, you’ll need to write your own implementations of LogDataReceiver and possibly LogReplaySource (if you save the files in anything other than WPILOG). Also keep in mind that replay will not work with any generic WPILOG file: the timestamps and record order need to match what AdvantageKit natively writes, which ensures the data is properly synchronized to the loop cycle.

You may also want to evaluate whether this amount of manual work is necessary. All file IO and data encoding runs on a background thread in AdvantageKit, and is designed to be fault tolerant such that it cannot interfere with the execution of the main thread. Generally the performance impact of file IO is therefore negligible. If you have data suggesting that file IO is causing an issue, we would of course like to get that fixed.

Thanks a lot, seems like it might not be necessary then, we will see the runtimes and go from there
